author: Gautama Buddha
quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one getting burned.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: I know God will not give me anything I can't handle. I just wish that He didn't trust me so much.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Fear defeats more people than any other one thing in the world.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: Suspicion is most often useless pain.

author: John Keats
quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced. Even a proverb is no proverb to you till your life has illustrated it.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: In nature we never see anything isolated, but everything in connection with something else which is before it, beside it, under it and over it.

author: Robert Bresson
quote: Cinema, radio, television, magazines are a school of inattention: people look without seeing, listen in without hearing.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Anybody can be good in the country. There are no temptations there.

author: Wayne Dyer
quote: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: No one ever became great by imitation.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Not to have control over the senses is like sailing in a rudderless ship, bound to break to pieces on coming in contact with the very first rock.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: He that never thinks can never be wise.

author: Phyllis McGinley
quote: Words can sting like anything, but silence breaks the heart.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: When firmness is sufficient, rashness is unnecessary.

author: Hilaire Belloc
quote: From quiet homes and first beginning, out to the undiscovered ends, there's nothing worth the wear of winning, but laughter and the love of friends.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Society often forgives the criminal; it never forgives the dreamer.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: Each man must look to himself to teach him the meaning of life. It is not something discovered: it is something molded.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: The charm of history and its enigmatic lesson consist in the fact that, from age to age, nothing changes and yet everything is completely different.

author: Confucius
quote: We take greater pains to persuade others we are happy than in trying to think so ourselves.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Nothing shows a man's character more than what he laughs at.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: Men are moved by two levers only: fear and self interest

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: That's why many fail because they don't get started they don't go. They don't overcome inertia. They don't begin.

author: Voltaire
quote: Anyone who seeks to destroy the passions instead of controlling them is trying to play the angel.

author: Frank Dane
quote: A man who calls bullshit fertilizer.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow; Don't walk behind me, I may not lead; Walk beside me, and just be my friend.

author: John Wesley
quote: Beware you be not swallowed up in books! An ounce of love is worth a pound of knowledge.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: All is soon mended, but hard words permanently bruise the heart.

author: Olive Schreiner
quote: There was never a great man who had not a great mother.

author: Mark Twain
quote: I can teach anybody how to get what they want out of life. The problem is that I can't find anybody who can tell me what they want.

author: Don Marquis
quote: He worked like hell in the country so he could live in the city, where he worked like hell so he could live in the country.

author: Maxwell Maltz
quote: It is an old psychological axiom that constant exposure to the object of fear immunizes against the fear.

author: Mark Twain
quote: In his private heart no man much respects himself.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: When all is said the greatest action is to limit and isolate one's self.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I don't like that man. I'm going to have to get to know him better.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: I am the greatest, I said that even before I knew I was.

author: Baruch Spinoza
quote: Only that thing is free which exists by the necessities of its own nature, and is determined in its actions by itself alone.

author: Mike Tyson
quote: Men are not meant to be humble, they are meant to be humbled.

author: Josiah Gilbert Holland
quote: A mind grows by what it feeds on.

author: Josiah Gilbert Holland
quote: The person who does not know how to live while they are making a living is a poorer person after their wealth is won than when they started.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Problems cannot be solved at the same level of awareness that created  them.

author: Earl Nightingale
quote: People with goals succeed because they know where they're going.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Thousands of geniuses live and die undiscovered either by themselves or by others.

author: Margaret Oliphant Oliphant
quote: Temptations come, as a general rule, when they are sought.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: We must learn our limits. We are all something but none of us are everything.

author: Anatole France
quote: I thank fate for having made me born poor. Poverty taught me the true value of the gifts useful to life.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
quote: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.

author: E. B. White
quote: The whole problem is to establish communication with ones self.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: To believe in something, and not to live it, is dishonest.

author: Orson Welles
quote: Everybody denies I am a genius but nobody ever called me one!

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: There has never been a statue erected to honor a critic.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: If it happens once, it will never happen again. If it happens twice, it will happen a third time.

author: Kevin Gates
quote: The flowers don't chase the bees. The flowers just are and the bees come.

author: Herbet A. Simon
quote: An abundance of information leads to a poverty of attention.

author: James Clear
quote: When you say yes to something, you’re saying no to every other option.
